HTMLTextAreaElementSelectionStart.summary: The selectionStart property of the interface specifies the start position of the current text selection in a {{HTMLElement("textarea")}} element. It is a number representing the beginning index of the selected text. It can be used to both retrieve and set the start of the index of the beginning of a <textarea>s selected text.

remarks.para: When nothing is selected, the value of both the selectionStart and is the position of the cursor (caret) inside the <textarea> element.

Setting selectionStart to a value greater then the current value of updates both the the selectionStart and selectionEnd properties to that value. If that value is equal to or greater than the , both properties are both set to the textLength property value.
The property value can be retrieved and set without the <textarea> having focus, but the element does need to have focus for the {{cssxref("::selection")}} pseudo-element to match the selected text.
Setting the selectionStart to a new value fires the and events.
